title: Workplace interaction
text:
%load_ext autoreload
%autoreload 2

The autoreload extension is already loaded. To reload it, use:
  %reload_ext autoreload
Import some plotting libraries and set some defaults:
import sys
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
from IPython.display import display, Markdown
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
sns.set()
sns.set_style("whitegrid")

import random
random_seed = 5

sys.path.append('..')
from global_params import load_params
%config InlineBackend.figure_formats = ['svg']
params = load_params('../global_params.yml')
params

{'sample_size': 24}
params.sample_size

24

title: Workplace interaction
text:

subjects = pd.read_csv('../data/data_table.csv')
assert subjects.index.size == params.sample_size

---> 11 for i, q in enumerate(params.questions)])
     12 }
     13 """)

AttributeError: 'Params' object has no attribute 'questions'



In interviewed {python} params.sample_size workplace individuals were interviewed by …. blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah,


#| label: tbl-measured-informality
#| tbl-cap: "Informality quantified for subjects in the study."

df = pd.DataFrame({'name': subjects.name, 
                   'seniority': np.random.randint(0, 5, params.sample_size), 
                   'age': subjects.age})
df['informality'] = np.random.normal(loc=10, scale=1, size=params.sample_size)
df

sns.scatterplot(x='age', y='informality', data=df, hue='seniority', palette='viridis')
plt.ylabel('How informal you can be')
plt.xlabel('Age')
plt.legend(title='Seniority', loc='lower right', labels=['Undergrad', 'Postgrad', 'PhD', 'Postdoc', 'Professor'])
plt.ylim(bottom=0) ;







Figure 1: Interaction among Danes: How Danes interact is has very little to do with age and seniority, compared to most other contries.





Seems Danish people act very informally unaffected by age and seniority.

informality_age_cor = df.informality.corr(df.age)
informality_age_cor

0.11331363182555239



informality_seniority_cor = df.informality.corr(df.seniority)
informality_seniority_cor

0.03700382395304842




The correlation between informality and age was 0.113 and the correlation between informality and seniority was 0.037.



sns.lmplot(x='age', y='informality', data=df, hue='seniority', palette='viridis')
plt.ylabel('How informal you can be')
plt.xlabel('Age') ;







Figure 2: Interaction among Danes: Regressions of informality against age for five levels of seniority.

title: Overview
text:
Installation

PixicondaPip


pixi workspace channel add munch-group
pixi add vsnb


conda install -c munch-group vsnb


pip install vsnb
